documentation.text:
@dev Wrapped CHI (WCHI) token.  This contract is not upgradable and not
 owned, but it grants an initial supply to the contract creator.  The Xaya
 team will hold these tokens, and give them out for CHI locked on the
 Xaya network.  When WCHI tokens are returned, those CHI will be released
 again.
@dev Native CHI has 8 decimals (like BTC), we mimic that here.

@dev Initial supply of tokens minted.  This is a bit larger than the
 real total supply of CHI.

@dev Allowances for accounts (second) to spend from the balance
 of an owner (first).

@dev Sets the allowance afforded to the given spender by
 the message sender.
@dev Burns tokens from the sender's balance, reducing total supply.

@dev Decreases the allowance of a given spender by a certain value.
 If the value is more than the current allowance, it is set to zero.

@dev Internal helper function to check the balance of the given user
 and deduct the given amount.

@dev Internal helper function to explicitly set the allowance of
 a spender without any checks, and emit the Approval event.

attributes.text:
@dev Wrapped CHI (WCHI) token.  This contract is not upgradable and not
 owned, but it grants an initial supply to the contract creator.  The Xaya
 team will hold these tokens, and give them out for CHI locked on the
 Xaya network.  When WCHI tokens are returned, those CHI will be released
 again.
@dev Native CHI has 8 decimals (like BTC), we mimic that here.

@dev Initial supply of tokens minted.  This is a bit larger than the
 real total supply of CHI.

@dev Allowances for accounts (second) to spend from the balance
 of an owner (first).

@dev Sets the allowance afforded to the given spender by
 the message sender.
@dev Burns tokens from the sender's balance, reducing total supply.

@dev Decreases the allowance of a given spender by a certain value.
 If the value is more than the current allowance, it is set to zero.

@dev Internal helper function to check the balance of the given user
 and deduct the given amount.

@dev Internal helper function to explicitly set the allowance of
 a spender without any checks, and emit the Approval event.

devdoc.details: Wrapped CHI (WCHI) token.  This contract is not upgradable and not owned, but it grants an initial supply to the contract creator.  The Xaya team will hold these tokens, and give them out for CHI locked on the Xaya network.  When WCHI tokens are returned, those CHI will be released again.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets the allowance afforded to the given spender by the message sender.

burn(uint256).details: Burns tokens from the sender's balance, reducing total supply.

constructor.details: In the constructor, we grant the contract creator the initial balance. This is the only place where any address has special rights compared to all others.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Decreases the allowance of a given spender by a certain value. If the value is more than the current allowance, it is set to zero.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Increases the allowance of a given spender by a certain amount (rather than explicitly setting the new allowance).  This fails if the new allowance would be at infinity (or overflow).

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves a given amount of tokens from the message sender's account to the recipient.  If to is the zero address, then those tokens are burnt and reduce the total supply.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves a given amount of tokens from the sender account to the recipient.  If from is not the message sender, then it needs to have sufficient allowance.

allowance.details: Allowances for accounts (second) to spend from the balance of an owner (first).

decimals.details: Native CHI has 8 decimals (like BTC), we mimic that here.

initialSupply.details: Initial supply of tokens minted.  This is a bit larger than the real total supply of CHI.

totalSupply.details: Total supply of tokens.  This includes tokens that are in the Xaya team's reserve, i.e. do not correspond to real CHI locked in the treasury.
